article.headline: Oklahoma 76, Cent. Arkansas 73
article.story: NORMAN, Okla. -- Freshman Cameron Clark scored a career-high 26 points, and Oklahoma fought off a second-half rally by Central Arkansas to beat the Bears 76-73 on Thursday night. Central Arkansas (4-9) rallied from an 11-point deficit to tie it up twice in the final 5 minutes, but Oklahoma answered each time to stay perfect at home this season. Carl Blair drove for a layup with 2:06 remaining to put the Sooners (7-6) ahead to stay, and Andrew Fitzgerald followed with a three-point play for extra cushion. Chris Henson missed a potential tying 3-pointer from the left wing with 37 seconds left, and Blair and Clark sealed the win with three free throws. Imad Qahwash led Central Arkansas with 15 points, and Dewan Clayborn scored 13.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
